1.軍司令部に到着した <pc>たちは|エテーネ王国の 慰霊碑を訪れた。すると|メレ:
Arriving at the Royal Army Headquarters,| and the others visited the|Cenotaph of Ethene Kingdom. Then Mereade also|
|came to the cenotaph.

2.「<kyodai>……。| 弟のために わざわざ ありがとう。: <kyodai>... thanks for going out of your|way to help my brother.

3.「ううん。おいらこそ もっと早く| ここに来られたら よかったんだけど。: No. I wish I could have come here earlier.

4.「……あれからね。| おいらも 色々あったんだよ クオード。: ...Since then. I've been through a lot, Quard.

5.「何千年も 時渡りを くり返しながら| 心のどこかで 思ってたんだ。: I've been thinking about it in the back of my|mind for thousands of years while time|traveling.

6.「おいらさえ あきらめなければ……| 君が あやまちを起こさない未来に| たどり: If only I hadn't given up... we could have|reached a future where you didn't make the|same mistakes.

7.「でも そんなの 思い上がりでさ。| エテーネの村の悲劇を 止められないのと同じ: But that's hubris. Just as nothing could stop|the tragedy in Ethene Village, the reality|is...it was very cruel.

8.「……今でも 悔やんでる。| もっと 他の方法が あったんじゃないか。| 君のた: I still regret it. I thought there was a|better way. I could have done something for|you.

9.「私も……。私も あなたと同じです。| あやまちを犯した人を 救えずに| ずっと: I'm... I'm the same as you. I've been feeling|sorry for myself for not being able to save|someone who made a mistake.

10.「私のお姉様は 取り返しのつかない 罪を犯し| 最後は 贖罪のように 散っていき: My sister committed an irrevocable sin, and in|the end, she was scattered as if in atonement.

11.「それでも お姉様が 世界を守るために戦った| 強くて 優しい人だったことは 変:
Even so, it doesn't change the fact that your|sister was a strong and gentle person who|fought to protect the world. I want to carry|
|on her memory.

12.「あなたも どうか 失った人の思いを| 大切にしてあげてくださいね……。: And you, please, cherish the thoughts of those|you have lost...

13.「うん……おいらも忘れない。| クオードが 大切にしていたものを。: Yeah...I won't forget it either. I'll never|forget what Quard meant to me.

14.「我らは ここに誓う。| 自らのチカラで 時を生き| よりよき未来へ 向かわんこ: We hereby pledge. We hereby pledge that we|will use our own strength to live through time|and face a better future...

15.「クオードも そう 望んでいたと思う。: I'm sure Quard would have wanted that.

16.「あなたが遺した 思いと未来……| 私が 継いでいくわ クオード。: I will carry on your legacy of thought and|future, Quard.

18.<pc>たちは それぞれに|命を落とした者たちを 思い浮かべながら|静かに 祈り: <pc> prayed silently, remembering|those who lost their lives...

19.メレアーデは 涙をぬぐって 去っていった。|クオードを悼むことができた <kyo: Mereade wiped away her tears and left.|<kyodai>, who was able to mourn Quard,|once again promised to help.
